title: Blended Learning Course Based on Mathematical Modeling for Strengthening IoT Adult Educators' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced mastery of mathematical theories (statistics, probability, equations, calculus) and high-level application techniques
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining MOOCs and offline workshops, utilizing Open Educational Resources (OERs) with a focus on quantitative analysis of IoT data and mathematical reasoning. It particularly emphasizes graph interpretation for identifying data patterns and the ability to draw evidence-based conclusions.

learning_goals: Learners will explain the basic principles and application cases of IoT technology using mathematical modeling, equations, and formulas.
Learners will design and implement time-series data analysis and probability distribution graph visualization content for IoT-based educational materials via MOOC platforms.
Through project-based learning (PBL), learners will develop statistical inference scenarios using IoT sensor data and build probabilistic evaluation models.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
